name: Bismarck
acquisitionMethod: Event: Scherzo of Iron and Blood

1.name: Wahrheit
1.description: This ship's first Volley will always Critically Hit. While equipping a CL Gun in the Auxiliary Weapon slot: sets the Range of the CL Gun to 65 (90) and decreases their DMG by 35%.

2.name: Unwavering Strength
2.description: When this ship fires a Salvo while sortied as the Flagship: 40.0% (70.0%) chance to fire a special barrage. Also increases the DMG of all your Iron Blood Carriers by 10% (20%).

3.name: Will of the Iron Blood
3.description: Increases the Main Gun, Torpedo, and Airstrike Crit Rate of all your Iron Blood ships by 4.0% (20.0%), increases their RLD by 4.5% (12.0%), and increases Tirpitz's DMG by 20% (40%).

1.chinese: 俾斯麦级战列舰—俾斯麦
1.japanese: ビスマルク級戦艦・ビスマルク

2.chinese: 被冠以俾斯麦之名的铁血战列舰，就是我。凭借着铁血式的防护和装甲设计，无论是在哪里我都会展现出自己最强的实力的，你要期待的话也不是不可以
2.chineseTL: The metalblood battleship that was named after Bismarck, that's me. With metalblood's protection and armor designs, I'll show my strongest strength no matter where I am. You can look forward to it.
2.japanese: ビスマルクの名を預かる鉄血戦艦がこの私よ。鉄血式の防御と装甲設計で、どんな戦場でも最高の実力を発揮してみせる。期待してもいいわよ？
2.english: I am the Iron Blood battleship entrusted with the name Bismarck. Allow me to prove that Iron Blood engineering is the finest in the world, no matter the battlefield. Eager to see for yourself?

3.chinese: Guten Tag，我是俾斯麦，我的御敌经验可是相当丰富的，有疑问尽管请教我就好
3.chineseTL: Guten Tag, I'm bismarck. My combat experience is quite bountiful. If you have any questions, feel free to ask me.
3.japanese: Guten Tag、私はビスマルク。敵との戦闘経験なら結構あるわ。問題あれば私に聞いてくれ
3.english: Guten Tag, I am Bismarck. I have fought many foes on many fronts. You may call upon me whenever there is a problem.

4.chinese: 我对你也是抱有期待的
4.chineseTL: I too have expectations of you.
4.japanese: あなたには期待しているわよ
4.english: I look forward to working with you.

5.chineseTL: Do I have something on my face?
5.japanese: 私の顔に何かついているのか？
5.english: Is there something on my face?

6.chinese: 有困扰吗？我的战斗经验很丰富的
6.chineseTL: Are you having any troubles? I have plenty of combat experience
6.japanese: 困ってる？私の戦闘経験で役に立てるか？
6.english: Is there a problem? Perhaps my combat experience could prove useful?

7.chinese: “莱茵演习”吗？对我来说是个不好的回忆呢
7.chineseTL: Operation Rheinübung...? I don't have any good memories of it.
7.japanese: 「ライン演習」か？あまりいい思い出ではないようね…
7.english: "Operation Rheinübung?" I don't have fond memories of it...

8.chinese: 指挥官又一脸懈怠的表情了，来，抬头挺胸，睁大眼睛！很好！
8.chineseTL: Commander's slacking off again. Come, Lift your head and puff up your chest! Good!
8.japanese: 指揮官まだ気怠い顔して…さあ、頭をあげて、胸はしゃんと、目ははっきり！よし！
8.english: Such a slovenly expression, Commander. Now! Lift your chin, puff out your chest, and let me see those eyes! Hut!

9.chineseTL: I'm just not used to expressing my feelings.. please don't tease me.
9.japanese: 人を気安く触らないで

10.chinese: 我只是不擅长将感情表现出来，请不要故意逗我……
10.japanese: 私、感情表現が苦手なだけ。あまりからかわないで……
10.english: I... am not good at expressing myself. Please do not tease me on purpose...

11.chinese: 没做完任务的人没资格上战场
11.chineseTL: Those who have not fulfilled their mission have no rights to be on the battlefield.
11.japanese: 任務もこなせない人間に戦場に出る資格はないわ。
11.english: Those who cannot finish their missions have no right to stand on the battleground.

12.japanese: 報酬はここに置いたわよ……
12.english: I'm leaving the mission rewards over here...

13.japanese: 新しいメールは早めに確認して
13.english: Be diligent about checking your mail.

14.chinese: 辛苦了，稍微放松一下吧
14.chineseTL: Good work, let's relax for a bit.
14.japanese: お疲れ様、少しゆっくりしていいわ
14.english: You've done well. You've earned your rest.

15.chinese: ……委托组回来了，我先去迎接她们了
15.chineseTL: our fleet is back, I'll go receive them.
15.japanese: ……委託組が帰ってきたようね。先に迎えてくるわ
15.english: ... The commission team has returned. I'll go greet them first.

17.chinese: 大家请务必紧随我，别跟着欧根走了。对面的，不管多少，尽管来吧！
17.chineseTL: Everyone, follow me and not Eugen. To the enemy: I don't care about your numbers. Bring it on!
17.japanese: オイゲンではなく、私についてきて！さあ、相手がどれだけ多かろうが、一気にかかってこい！
17.english: Follow me, not Eugen. Come – we shall face our opponents, no matter how numerous they may be!

18.chinese: 弱者可能会为此而欣喜，不过，我很强
18.chineseTL: The weak might take pride in this, but I'm strong.
18.japanese: 弱いものならこの栄誉に喜ぶかも知れないが、私が強いからな
18.english: Such honors may please a weakling, but I am strong.

19.chinese: 玷污我骄傲的罪，就在下回以命赎清吧
19.chineseTL: Arrogance is my greatest sin. I'll redeem myself next time.
19.japanese: 私のプライドを傷つけた罪は…次は命で償ってもらうわよ
19.english: For tarnishing my pride... next time, you will pay with your lives.

20.chinese: 真理只在我的射程范围内
20.chineseTL: Truth is within my firing range
20.japanese: 我の射程内にのみ真理あり！
20.english: Truth can only be found within our range!

21.japanese: みんな……私の後ろに隠れていて

22.chineseTL: Please allow me to have some quiet time alone.
22.japanese: 一人で静かにしてくれ

23.chinese: 我可不是那么容易取悦的!
23.chineseTL: I'm not that easy to please!
23.japanese: 私、そう簡単に喜ばないわよ
23.english: I am not so easily impressed.

24.chinese: 你是个不错的指挥官呢……怎么了，我夸人很少见吗？……是你太大惊小怪了
24.chineseTL: You're a pretty good commander... What is it? It's rare for me to praise people? You're just overreacting.
24.japanese: あなた、いい指揮官ね……なに？私が人を褒めるのはそんなに珍しい？……いちいち反応しすぎよ
24.english: You're not a bad commander... What? Is it so strange for me to give compliments? ... You're simply overreacting.

25.chinese: 怎么了，一直盯着我看，我的脸上有什么吗？漂亮？……谢谢
25.chineseTL: What is it, why are you starting at me? Is there something on my face? Beautiful?..... thanks.
25.japanese: じっと見てて何があるの？私の顔に何か付いている？綺麗？……あ、ありがとう
25.english: Why are you staring at me? Do I have something on my face? I'm pretty, you say...? Um, thank you...

26.chinese: 我……对于感情表现不太拿手，但是……我想让你知道，能看到你在身边，我就十分幸福……
26.chineseTL: I'm not good at expressing my feelings but I just want to let you kno... just feeling you by my side fills me with happiness.
26.japanese: 私……感情表現があまり得意ではないけど、しかし……あなたには知ってほしい。あなたのそばにいる私が幸せだということを……
26.english: I... know that I'm not the best with words, but.. I want you to know that... I enjoy being at your side...

27.chinese: …指挥官…这种时候我该露出什么表情比较好？——微笑……吗？
27.chineseTL: Commander... what expression should I put on? ---- a smile...?
27.japanese: …指揮官、こういう時どんな顔すればいいかわからないのーー笑えば……いいのか？
27.english: ... Commander, what kind of expression should I have at a time like this? I should... just smile?
